title: The Plurality of Worlds: A Sixteenth-Century Space Opera
description: In 1572, during the reign of Queen Jane, English mathematician Thomas Digges pilots an ethership designed by John Dee into orbit around the Earth, to discover whether the ether can sustain life. Accompanying Digges are privateer Francis Drake, adventurer Walter Raleigh, the Earl of Oxford, Edward de Vere, and John Field, a representative of the Archibishop of Canterbury. Although the men return home safely, their troubles-and those of the human race-have just begun.... "The Plurality of Worlds" is undoubtedly the finest sixteenth-century space opera ever penned-but not, one hopes, the last!
author: Brian M. Stableford
